column3: Traffic;Phnom Penh: A woman suspected of being drunk drove a Toyota Prius into the back of a Highlander
column4: which then bumped into another Toyota Prius at a traffic light
column6: but fortunately no one was injured.------The incident occurred at 12:20 AM on August 22
column7: 2020 at the Freedom stoplight along Monivong Blvd.
column8: at right angles to Kampuchea Krom Road. In Sangkat Monorom
column10: Phnom Penh.------According to sources at the scene
column12: a Toyota Prius with license plate Phnom Penh 2BI-0023 was seen traveling along Monivong Blvd. It stopped waiting for the traffic light
column13: while a white Highlander with license plate Phnom Penh 2AU-0961 was traveling in the same direction stopped behind.------Suddenly a red Toyota Prius with license plate Phnom Penh 2AV-6078
column14: driven by a woman suspected of being drunk
column15: drove from behind at high speed
column16: hit the back of the Highlander and pushed it into the stopped Prius. The red Prius suffered serious damage
column17: but the other cars appear to have only minor damage.------After the incident
column19: with both parties asking for a compromise. The bad driving woman offered to pay to repair both vehicles to end the story at the scene.Â ------NKD
